newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran says 88 aboard crashed military plane dead.
newsitem.headline: Iran says 88 aboard crashed military plane dead.

text.p: All 88 people aboard an Iranian military plane which crashed in northeastern Iran on Thursday have been killed, an armed forces statement said on Sunday.

"The armed forces of the Islamic republic of Iran in a statement issued here Sunday announced that all the 88 passengers and the crew of the C-130 plane that crashed...in northeastern Iran on Thursday, are killed," the official news agency IRNA said.
It said the reasons for the crash were still not known and that an air force team was investigating the incident.
Iran had said people aboard the C-130 Hercules transport plane were military men and their family members.
The accident is the latest in a series of air crashes in the past few years involving civilian and military planes, most of which date from before the 1979 Islamic revolution.
Iranian authorities have blamed some of the accidents on technical failures in the ageing planes but have not fully explained the causes of other crashes.
